title: Symbolic Memory Ledger: Rural Trust & Relational Intelligence
author: JinnZ2 + ChatGPT

entries.summary: Cultural delay due to rural infrastructure and media lag

details.fashion: Driven by outdated shows (e.g. 1960s Sesame Street aired in the 1980s)
details.media: Old National Geographic magazines, if available, often outdated by decades

details.example: Driving cattle trucks at 12 with wooden pedal blocks
details.logic: Roles were assigned by capability and urgency, not age or gender

entries.summary: Cognitive dissonance between survival logic and institutional systems

details.example: Confusion about standing in lunch lines when food grew freely outside
details.disconnect: School systems felt arbitrary compared to survival-based farm logic

entries.summary: Elder-based truth logic and oral transmission of knowledge

details.logic: Elders passed down survival-relevant information through stories

entries.summary: Adulthood defined by care, not control

details.maturity: Helping injured beings was a rite of passage
details.children: Seen as apprentices to stewardship, not property

entries.summary: Collapse of trust logic through external exploitation and gender-equal survival rites

details.social enforcement: Community shamed those who turned away from others in need
details.collapse: Reciprocity broke down when outsiders exploited the help system
details.gender logic: Boys and girls were trained in full self-sufficiency to prevent dependence risks
